div.l: Weri and wete as a best is in þe rayne
Cometh seli Iohn and with hīm cometh Aleyn̄
Alas qduod Iohn þe dai þat I was born̄e
Now ar we driuen̄ to hethyng and to scorne
Oure corn̄ is stole men wil vs foles call
Both þe wardein and othir felawes all
And namly þe myller welawey
Þus pleyneth Iohn as he go bi þe wey
Towardꝭes þe mylle and baiard in his honde
Þe myller sittyng bi þe fir͗e he fonde
For it was night and ferther might þei not
But for þe loue of god þey hīm be sought
Of herborogh and ese as for her͗e peny
Þe myller answered if þer͗e be any
Suche as it is yit shal ye haue yoʳur parte
Mi house is streit but ye haue lerned arte
Ye can bi argunıentꝭesargunentꝭesargumentꝭes make a place
A myle brode of xxᵗⁱ fote of space
Late se now if þis space may suffice
Or make it rōmmer with speche as is yoʳur gise
Now Simond seid Iohn bi seint Cutberte
Ay is þou meri and þat is fair͗e answerde
I haue herd sey þat shuld take of two þinges
Suche as he fyndez or such as he bringes
But specialli I prai þe oost der͗e
Gete vs som̄ mete ⁊and drink and make vs cher͗e
And we wol pray truly atte full
With empti hondes men may no haukes tull
Lo her͗e oure siluer redy for to spende
The myller to þe towne his dought̉er sende
For ale and brede and rosted þeim a goose
And bond her̉e horse þat shuld no lo lo mor̉e go lose
And in his own̄ chambr̉e he made a bedde
With shetes and with chalons fair̉e spredde
Not fro his own̄ bedde x · fote or xij
His dought̉er hath a bedde al bi hir̉e self
Right in þe same chambr̉e bi and by
It might be no better and þe cause whi
Ther̉e was no rommer herborow in þe place
Þei supposed and spak of solas
And drank euer strong ale atte best
Aboute midnyȝt þei went to rest
Well hath þis myller vernyshed his hede
